com.itko.lisa.test

Class Environment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.itko.util.env.EnvProperties
      • com.itko.lisa.test.Environment

  • public class Environment
extends com.itko.util.env.EnvProperties
    This class performs all the basic initialization that's needed to get LISA running. Works not only for running the LISA test package, but as a basis for everything else too.
    All you need to do is construct this guy and he'll execute all the init code you expect. Put it at the very top of your main() and you'll be home free.

      • refreshSystemProperties

      • invalidateLicense

        public static void invalidateLicense()
        Remove any references to a license FRAME-1298: Be REALLY careful calling this, it checks in and wipes out EVERYTHING having to do with a license

      • isLicenseValid

        public static boolean isLicenseValid()
        Should be called by all full-fledged Lisa suite components. Will tell us whether to die or stay alive.

        This may one day include the test for app name as passed in. If you are not a Swing/UI type app, you can just exit from here, b/c we've already logged it to the fatal log appender.

        Returns:
        true if the user's license is not expired

        Returns:

      • setUseAutoRedeployClassLoader

        public static void setUseAutoRedeployClassLoader(boolean b)
        Used by the Test Manger to make the class loader the one that senses changes and redploys itself as needed.

        Note that if you pass true here, we ignore attempts to set the classpath from outside b/c that would make everything blow up...

        Parameters:
        b - true if you want it, false to use a static one (the default is use static)

      • getClassLoader

        public static java.lang.ClassLoader getClassLoader()
        Lisa supports loading classes not only from the system CLASSPATH, but from a hotdeploy path set as a propery lisa.hotDeploy.
        Returns:
        a ClassLoader that will load resources from the hot deploy path, or if an error occured, the System ClassLoader is returned an the error is logged

      • getDefaultKeyStoreProperties

        Parameters:

      • getClientKeyStorePath

        public static java.lang.String getClientKeyStorePath()
        Retrieves the path to the SSL client keystore file, based on what is configured in the environment. The following shows the order that properties are preferred (in descending order)
        • ssl.client.cert.path
        • lisa.default.keystore
        • {{LISA_HOME}}webreckeys.ks
        Returns:
        The path to the SSL client keystore file.

      • getClientKeyStorePassword

        public static java.lang.String getClientKeyStorePassword()
        Retrieves the path to the SSL client keystore password, based on what is configured in the environment. The following shows the order that properties are preferred (in descending order)
        • ssl.client.cert.pass.encrypted
        • ssl.client.cert.pass
        • lisa.default.keystore.pass.encrypted
        • lisa.default.keystore.pass
        • "passphrase" (the passphrase of the keystore file stored in {{LISA_HOME}}webreckeys.ks)
        Returns:
        The path to the SSL client keystore password.

      • getServerKeyStorePath

        public static java.lang.String getServerKeyStorePath()
        Retrieves the path to the SSL server keystore file, based on what is configured in the environment. The following shows the order that properties are preferred (in descending order)
        • ssl.server.cert.path
        • {{LISA_HOME}}webreckeys.ts
        Returns:
        The path to the SSL server keystore file.

      • getServerKeyStorePassword

        public static java.lang.String getServerKeyStorePassword()
        Retrieves the path to the SSL server keystore password to use during VSE recording and playback (Listen Step), based on the ssl.server.cert.pass or ssl.server.cert.pass.encrypted properties configured in the environment. The following shows the order that properties are preferred (in descending order)
        • ssl.server.cert.pass.encrypted
        • ssl.server.cert.pass
        • "passphrase" (the passphrase of the keystore file stored in {{LISA_HOME}}webreckeys.ks)
        Returns:
        The path to the SSL server keystore password, based on the ssl.server.cert.pass or ssl.server.cert.pass.encrypted properties configured in the environment. If neither of these properties have been set, then password associated with the default SSL server keystore file is returned.

        public static TestRegistry setDefaultTestRegistry()
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        CORE-464: Connect to the default Registry. This is equivalent to setTestRegistry((String) null).
        Returns:
        The default Registry instance obtained. This will never be null.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If the Registry connection fails
        java.io.IOException - If an attempt to start a Regsitry as a separate process fails

      • setTestRegistry

        public static TestRegistry setTestRegistry(java.lang.String url,
                           boolean autostart)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        CORE-464: Set the current registry using its name. If code null is passed as the name then a default name will be obtained from one of two places: 1. SiteProperties.getAutoTestRegistryName() 2. System property: TestRegistry.TEST_REGISTRY_KEY
        Parameters:
        autostart - if true, we'll boot up the registry; if false, we assume Registry is already up
        Returns:
        The Registry instance obtained using the name. This will never be null.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If the Registry connection fails
        java.io.IOException - If an attempt to start a Regsitry as a separate process fails

      • isLocalRegistryAutoShutdown

        public static boolean isLocalRegistryAutoShutdown()
        Determine whether the current application should shut down any Registry that it starts or whether it should leave the Registry running.
        Returns:
        true if any registry started by this application should be shut down when the applicaiton exits. false if any registry started by this application should continue running after the application exits.

      • startLocalTestRegistry

        public static TestRegistry startLocalTestRegistry(java.lang.String url)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Launch a Registry instance on the local host bound to the given name and connect to it. If the running application is LISA Workstation, VSE Workstation, or Virtual Service Environment then the Registry will be started in-process and will be shut down when the application exits. For all other applications the Registry will be started as a separate process and will not be automatically shut down. This behavior can be change with the system property 'lisa.N.registry.local.autoshutdown', see lisa.properties for more details. Note: If a Registry instance already exists with the given name then a new Registry instance will *not* be started; it will use the already existing Registry.
        Returns:
        The registry instance regardless of whether a new one was started locally or a existing one was used.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        java.io.IOException

      • disconnectTestRegistry

        public static void disconnectTestRegistry()
        Disconnect from the current test registry. Note that this can also change system properties to remove the old registry's site properties.

      • getTestRegistry

        public static TestRegistry getTestRegistry()
        Get the current test registry after validating that the connection is still working. If the registry connection is down then it will be disconnected and null will be returned.
        Returns:
        The current test registry, or null if the current test registry fails to respond.

      • getTestRegistryName

        public static java.lang.String getTestRegistryName()
        Get the test registry name, if one is registered. If the registry is down then a placeholder name will be returned.
        Returns:
        The current registry's name, a placeholder if the test registry name could not be obtained, or null if there is no current test registry

      • isRegistryProcess

        public static boolean isRegistryProcess()
                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        CORE-613: Determine whether the Registry is running embedded in the current JVM
        Returns:
        true if the Registry is running embedded in the current JVM, or if the current JVM *is* the Registry process. false if the Registry is running in another JVM.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getAppDataDir

        public static java.lang.String getAppDataDir()
        Where will we store semi permanent LISA data (cvsDeploy, vseDeploy, reporting db, etc) Used to be LISA_HOME but that doesn't make sense on windows, especially if we are installed in "Program Files". On unix, LISA_HOME is OK, since it's typically installed underneath a home directory.
        Returns:
